column4: I have a problem lately getting updates from several repositories such as ftp://ftp.berlios.de unstable/non-free. What could cause that?
they are not ubuntu repos so you would need to talk to the people that run them
is there a list of standard+community ubuntu reps?
and is there a tool to autoupdate my list?
apt-get update
do you actually read the question? I want to update the list of repositories
to update the repos sudo apt-get update. what do you mean by update?
thats old and not kept up
what is old and not kept up?
easy source
ok then where do I get an updated list? again, apt-get update updates the list of packages, not of the list of repositories
what version of ubuntu are you on?
the repos have updated packages in them what do you mean updated list?
geez

for instance the non-free rep I had stopped working... new repositories are created by people... maybe some repositories have updated adresses. I want an updated list of available repositories. NOT PACKAGES.
define updated repos list please. if you mean unofficial repos you need to find them else where/ if you mean ubuntu repos than the ones in your list if all are uncommented you have latest
they most likely use the same ones
you want the newer version of unofficial repos see the opwners of the repos
we do not support unofficial repos
there is no page for unofficial repositories?
geez
not one that is kept up anymore
